configuration:
cluster.name node-1 Cluster Name Use a descriptive name for your cluster.
node.attr.rack r1 Node Arribute Rack Add custom attributes to the node.
network.host 0.0.0.0 Network Host Set the bind address to a specific IP. (IPv4 or IPv6)
http.port 9200 HTTP Port Set a custom port for HTTP
http.cors.enabled true
boolean false
HTTP CORS Enabled Enable or disable cross-origin resource sharing, which determines whether a browser on another origin can execute requests against Elasticsearch. Set to true to enable Elasticsearch to process pre-flight CORS requests. Elasticsearch will respond to those requests with the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header if the Origin sent in the request is permitted by the http.cors.allow-origin list. Set to false (the default) to make Elasticsearch ignore the Origin request header, effectively disabling CORS requests because Elasticsearch will never respond with the Access-Control-Allow-Origin response header.
http.cors.allow-origin * HTTP CORS Allow-Origin Which origins to allow. If you prepend and append a forward slash (/) to the value, this will be treated as a regular expression, allowing you to support HTTP and HTTPs. For example, using /https?:\/\/localhost(:[0-9]+)?/ would return the request header appropriately in both cases. Defaults to no origins allowed.
gateway.recover_after_data_nodes 0
int false
Gateway Recover After Nodes Recover as long as this many data nodes have joined the cluster.
gateway.recover_after_time 15m Gateway Recover After Time If the expected number of nodes is not achieved, the recovery process waits for the configured amount of time before trying to recover. Defaults to 5m if one of the expected_nodes settings is configured.
gateway.expected_data_nodes 0
int false
Gateway Expected Data Nodes Number of data nodes expected in the cluster. Recovery of local shards begins when the expected number of data nodes join the cluster. Defaults to 0.
action.destructive_requires_name true
boolean false
action destructive_requires_name Require explicit names when deleting indices `
